intro: Lippia hoehnei var. goyazensis, commonly known as Goiás mint, is a perennial herb native to Brazil. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated for use in traditional herbal remedies.
